prompt.content:
One type of beetle has 3 possible wing colors, blue, green and turquoise. Randomly caught individuals of a polymorphic population were crossed with each other.
It is a monohybrid inheritance with three alleles, B, G & T. Dominance: B > G > T
You get the parent phenotype, and the distribution of phenotypes in the F1 - generation. State the genotypes of the parents and offspring as accurately as possible. No further explanation necessary. If a given distribution is impossible, state 'impossible'.

data.expected: GT (Green) x GT (Green) -> 1/4 GG (Green), 1/2 GT (Green), 1/4 TT (Turquoise)
data.sampled:
Green x Green -> 3/4 GG (Green), 1/4 GT (Turquoise)

The parents are both homozygous for the green allele (GG), so all the offspring will inherit at least one copy of the green allele. Since the green allele is dominant, all the offspring will have the green phenotype. There is a 1/4 chance that each offspring will inherit the turquoise allele (T) from one of the parents, which results in a 1/4 chance of the turquoise phenotype. Therefore, the distribution of phenotypes in the F1 generation is 3/4 Green, 1/4 Turquoise.

The genotypes of the parents are GG (Green) and GG (Green). The genotypes of the offspring are GG (Green), GG (Green), GT (Turquoise), and GG (Green).
